page.title: 02TOURISM ON WHIPSIDERRY BEACH
page.content: On the 5.7.85 we interviewed tourists on Whipsiderry Beach.It was an overcast morning so we could only talk to ten people.Nine said that they found the area interesting, but the tenth had only arrived the night before.Those who had been on the beach said that it was flat, sandy and clean, with plenty of room for children.They said that the scenery was lovely but the steps which led to the beach seemed slightly dangerous although the sea seemed reasonably safe. They found the beach rarely became overcrowded. A lot of them enjoyed walking on Porth Headland. The people we interviewed were on holiday for two weeks and one lady has come to the area on holiday every year for forty years. The people said that they could get most of the things they needed at the nearby shops.
